definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: A country of six thousand, every twelve years the shortage of investment.
sentences.chinese: 一身去國六千里，萬死投荒十二年。

definition: to return to one's home country
to undertake advanced studies/to take a refresher course
to read a book/to study/to attend school
to travel around many countries (idiom); peregrinations/refers to the travels of Confucius
to go home to visit one's family
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
